quote: I think, therefore I am.
author: René Descartes

quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

quote: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
author: Aristotle

quote: Man is the measure of all things.
author: Protagoras

quote: He who has overcome his fears will truly be free.
author: Aristotle

quote: Panta rhei (Everything flows).
author: Heraclitus

quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

quote: Time is the wisest counselor of all.
author: Pericles

quote: Pleasure is the beginning and the end of a happy life.
author: Epicurus

quote: Justice is the constant and perpetual will to allot to every man his due.
author: Cicero

quote: Sapere aude (Dare to know).
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: Man is condemned to be free.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: Liberty consists in doing what one desires.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: The greatest happiness of the greatest number is the foundation of morals and legislation.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: Knowledge is power.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Man is born free, and everywhere he is in chains.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: The history of all hitherto existing society is the history of class struggles.
author: Karl Marx

quote: To be is to be perceived.
author: George Berkeley

quote: What is rational is actual, and what is actual is rational.
author: G.W.F. Hegel

quote: The purpose of life is a life of purpose.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
author: Laozi

quote: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
author: Buddha

quote: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
author: Laozi

quote: He who knows others is wise; he who knows himself is enlightened.
author: Laozi

quote: You will not be punished for your anger, you will be punished by your anger.
author: Buddha

quote: Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom.
author: Laozi

quote: Those who know do not speak. Those who speak do not know.
author: Laozi

quote: The wise man does not lay up his own treasures. The more he gives to others, the more he has for his own.
author: Laozi

quote: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
author: Buddha

quote: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
author: Laozi

quote: Life can only be understood backwards, but it must be lived forwards.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: Happiness is not an ideal of reason, but of imagination.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: Hell is other people.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: The life of man is solitary, poor, nasty, brutish, and short.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: What doesn't kill us makes us stronger.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Freedom is the recognition of necessity.
author: Friedrich Engels

quote: No great mind has ever existed without a touch of madness.
author: Aristotle

quote: Man is nothing else but what he makes of himself.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: Philosophy begins in wonder.
author: Plato

quote: An eye for an eye will leave the whole world blind.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Act only according to that maxim whereby you can at the same time will that it should become a universal law.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: The ends justify the means.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

quote: Our life is what our thoughts make it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Treat people as if they were what they ought to be and you help them to become what they are capable of being.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: It is not what we get. But who we become, what we contribute... that gives meaning to our lives.
author: Tony Robbins

quote: Ethics is nothing else than reverence for life.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: Morality is not the doctrine of how we may make ourselves happy, but how we may make ourselves worthy of happiness.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Do what you feel in your heart to be right—for you’ll be criticized anyway.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt
